channel.title: Daegu on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: 'Science, let's play!' Best playground, National Daegu Science Museum - Dalseong-gun, Daegu, Korea
item.description:
Daegu Science Museum exterior with the meaning of flying science

'Science, let's play!' Best playground, National Daegu Science Museum

Dalseong-gun, Daegu, Korea

What about the science museum that is exciting and exciting for children who are tired of studying? Daegu Science Museum is an exciting science playground. Difficult science is also an interesting friend when you touch, see, hear, and crawl. As you play and learn, your thoughts grow and your dreams of science grow.

The National Daegu Science Museum, where you can see 233 interesting exhibits, including the world's largest water clock, a center of gravity public bicycle, SOS to know all the earth's environments, and Korea's largest experiential exhibition life coaster. All of those exhibits are all interesting and novel, but there are ten amazing things you shouldn't miss. Let's meet the pride of the National Daegu Science Museum.

National Daegu Science Museum with many interesting exhibits

When you enter the Science Museum, the first thing that stands out is. It is a water clock 11m high. The sculpture, the world's largest water clock, is the work of French physicist and plastic artist Dr. Bernard Jitton. A large glass pipe moves 320 liters of liquid on the principle of free fall and siphon, and water fills the sphere representing the hours and minutes to tell the time. The water that flows unceasingly embodies the science that never stops and develops without staying.

The world's largest water clock
After passing the water clock, take the escalator to the second floor and there are two permanent exhibition halls on both sides. The left is the permanent exhibition hall 1 and the right is the permanent exhibition hall 2. The permanent exhibition hall 1 is a place where you can cultivate various ideas about the global environment.
The world's largest water clock
The core exhibit in Hall 1 is the SOS (Science On a Sphere) system. This large 2m diameter ball floating in the air is a system for observing global environmental changes. What is El Nino and what is La Nina? Where did the many east coast squid go? Will more snow fall in winter if global warming continues? How can we save the planet from warming? These questions are solved by standing in front of this big ball. If you are watching vivid images of typhoons' travel paths, world volcanic activity, and the Earth's night and day, you fall into the illusion of observing the Earth from space.
SOS system, the core exhibit of the 1st building

The most popular exhibition in Hall 1 is the public unicycle. The curiosity as to why I would fall after the circulating air rail with a unicycle is springing up. The answer is center of gravity! You can experience the meaning of the center of gravity through a large additional air bike. There is also a corner explaining the secrets of how an airplane can fly without losing its center.

Breathtaking aerial unicycle to find out the center of gravity
‘What did you feel?’ Is a place where students' curiosity is most triggered. Nothing can be seen through the black double curtain. The sound of water may be heard, the cool air may rub, and the smell of baking may be heard when you carefully watch with your hands. In addition to what we see, we realize how important sensory organs such as hearing, smell and touch are.
Children experiencing the “I Am a Scientist” Corner
When you go out there, the exhibitions explaining the optical illusion and the exhibitions that help you realize how important scientific thinking is are connected, and the 'I'm Scientist' section is connected. Marcel Duchamp's words are written in front of the toilet. “Think about what you are looking at. Think the most about the things you don't think most. ” After leaving the 1st building, the scientist's mind grows.
Children experiencing the “I Am a Scientist” Corner
The second building was designed to examine the science and technology that are dissolved in our lives. As soon as you enter Hall 2, a large cylindrical life coaster catches your eye so that the exhibition hall fills up. The life coaster, which boasts the largest size as an experiential exhibit in Korea, is an experience corner where you can think about energy.
Life Coaster, the largest experience exhibit in Korea
Fossil energy is 84% of the energy we use, such as gas for cooking food, electricity for operating computers, and gasoline for moving cars. What should we do to save fossil energy that cannot be used in the next 100 years?
The train moves through the oxidation reaction of hydrogen and oxygen
It uses green energy such as wind power, solar power, and hydrogen power and teaches the importance of energy by considering the problem of energy depletion and the need for alternative energy through a system designed to launch a rolling ball when energy is collected.
Visitors checking CO2 emissions
The most popular corner in Hall 2 is the robot show. This is a pleasant corner where you can see our robot technology, which is the third largest in the world, after Japan and Germany. Watching the robots dance excitingly to the latest music makes you feel proud and proud. The robot show is performed eight times a day.
A robot dancing to the song of Girls' Generation
In the astronomical projection hall with a dome screen of 16m in diameter, you can observe beautiful stars in the night sky and mysterious astronomical phenomena. All will enjoy vivid space travel with the latest sound and images screened by six of the latest digital projectors.
Children's building to learn while playing
The 4D movie theater, where you can enjoy live stereoscopic images through moving chairs and special effects, as well as videos and sounds, is so popular that there is no time to step on the weekend. The astronomical projection hall is operated 6 times a day, and the 4D movie theater is operated 9 times a day. All viewing provides NFC information service. When you put your smartphone on the exhibition information guide service sticker, the information on the exhibition appears on your smartphone.
A vivid space trip at the astronomical projection hall
The science yard prepared in the open air is a comprehensive play area decorated with a water exploration space that understands the principle of filling water using water wheels, and a jungle exploration play facility with slides and tunnels. The museum is open from 9:30 am to 5:30 pm and is closed the following day if it is a holiday on January 1st, on the day of the holiday, every Monday or Monday.
Exciting 4D movie theater with special effects and stereoscopic images
Travel information

National Daegu Science Museum
Address: 20, Techno-daero 6-gil, Yuga-myeon, Dalseong-gun, Daegu
Contact: 053-670-6114

www.dnsm.or.kr

1.Nearby Restaurants

Bauhaus: Pork BBQ / 95, Eumdong-gil, Yuga-myeon, Dalseong-gun / 080-614-3333

www.bawoosanjang.co.kr

Wonjohyeonpung Park Soseon Grandma Restaurant Gomtang: Gomtang / 56-1, Hyeonpungjungang-ro, Hyeonpung-myeon, Dalseong-gun / 053-615-1122

Dongi Restaurant: Dongyi Jeongsik / 165-7, Hansil-ro 6-gil, Dalseo-gu / 053-643-7799

2.Accommodation

Crystal Tourist Hotel: Dalseo-gu Dalgubeol-daero 1910 / 053-655-7799

Biseulsan Natural Recreation Forest: 230, Recreational Forest Road, Yuga-myeon, Dalseong-gun / 053-614-5481, 053-614-5482

http://sports.dalseong.daegu.kr/bisulsan/html/main.html

item.title: Exploration of Bangcheon Market where Kim Gwang-seok's song flows - Daegu, Korea
item.description:
Bangcheon Market with the sound of ukraine

Exploration of Bangcheon Market where Kim Gwang-seok's song flows

Daegu, Korea

If you go to Daegu, there is Gwangsuk Kim. Singer Kim Gwang-seok, he was born and raised here in Daebong-dong. Imagine the 5-year-old Kim Gwang-seok playing around somewhere on this street. How was this space remembered for him?

It was in 2002 that I first met him. There was always a banquet on one side of the studio, but a song was playing by the side. Those songs were more likely to be drunk than alcohol. One day, as time passed and I understood the words of the weekly ‘When I get older, the day to find this song will come,’ I searched for his traces.

It was an alley where he lived, which was sometimes a willingness to drink, and sometimes a willing comfort to a broken heart. I would definitely like to take a look at it once I have a chance.

Kim Gwangseok-gil filled with murals related to Gwangseok Kim
If you're breathing in a space like that, you don't know him, and it's just right for a fan to know him after he leaves.
Kim Gwangseok-gil filled with murals related to Gwangseok Kim
However, you cannot introduce a destination with a simple fan mind. Fortunately, Kim Gwangseok-gil is in contact with Bangcheon Market in Daegu, and we decided to look at them together.
Kim Gwangseok-gil filled with murals related to Gwangseok Kim

In 2009, 11 teams of artists joined together. The purpose was to create a Kim Gwang-seok road in honor of Kim Gwang-seok, who is better suited to the ‘Yuyu Poet’ than the singer. Kim Gwang-suk and his songs were recorded on the walls of the alley. The walls with lyrics of his song, which would not be lacking in poetry, provided an emotional journey to those who visited it. Did you add his song to it? When I am here, a cup is often eager.

Scenery of gwangsukgil

Kim Gwangseok-gil continues along one of the roads. Kim Gwang-suk rolls noodles in a stand, and Kim Gwang-suk is looking at the sea. Let's walk slowly. On the right, the Bangcheon Market opens.

Scenery of gwangsukgil
Kim Gwang-seok If you settle down at the Makgeolli store in Bangcheon Market where you touched the road again, you can take a drink with Kim Gwang-seok's song. Unfortunately, let's enter the Bangcheon market after a short encounter with him.
Scenery of gwangsukgil
Bangcheon Market is a traditional market located next to Suseonggyo Bridge. The wall of Suseonggyo is the main of Kim Gwangseok-gil, so it can be said to be right next door. After liberation in 1945, people from Japan and Manchuria started their business. Like Pohang's Jukdo Market and Busan's Jagalchi Market, Bangcheon Market was created and cultivated around the liberation and around June 25th. At that time, Bangcheon Market sold grains from Namdojak. It can be seen that it was a very active market. It's a good time.
Bangcheon Market Alley Scenery
At one time, Daegu's Seomun Market and Chilseong Market were selected as representative markets of Daegu, but now they cannot be hidden. The noisy marketplace has been blurred, but still breathing can still be heard.
Bangcheon Market Alley Scenery
In 2009, along with Kim Gwang-suk-gil, cultural artists flocked to the market. The art, which has flocked to the most intense daily market in everyday life, took off unnecessary clothing and brought to life. It's about bringing a new life to the market where art is falling. Every corner of the market began to be painted with pretty colored murals, and artists began to settle in the market one by one. The excitement they exuded was transmitted to the Bangcheon market, and this vitality is once again a driving force to attract people. In addition, the “Munjeonseong City” project was also added to promote the government's traditional market.
Bangcheon Market Alley Scenery

Although barely alive, the market is still quiet. The galleries located all over the place attract attention. Anywhere is good, so you can go to your favorite place and watch it. Especially if you visit here on a date, don't forget to have a cool drink at a pretty cafe in the market place. If you're alone, it's also a good idea to taste the delicious red bean shaved ice at the price of 3,000 won at the bakery in the corner. The old walls and shop signs barely seem to hang at the end of time. It is dangerous, but it is still firmly in place.

Bangcheon Market Alley Scenery

If you feel that Kim Gwangseok-gil and Bangcheon Market alone are not enough, you may want to continue walking through the alley tour including them. Samdeokbongsan Culture Road, the fourth course of Jung-gu alley tour from Daegu, leads to the National Treasury Compensation Movement Memorial Park ~ Samdeokdong Culture Street ~ Kim Gwangsuk-gil (Bangcheon Market) ~ Bongsan Culture Street ~ Daegu Hyanggyo ~ Gundel Rock. However, never walk in the sun. The total of 4.95km can be explored in about 3 hours, but the sun in Daegu is stronger than expected. Try moving early in the morning or after sunset. In addition to this, course 1 Gyeongsanggamyeong Dalseong-gil (3.25km, takes 2 hours 30 minutes), course 2 modern cultural alley (1.64km, takes 2 hours), course 3 fashion Korean medicine route (2.65km, takes 2 hours 50 minutes), 5 There are various alley tours such as the course Namsan 100 Years Hyangsu-gil (2.12km, 1 hour and 40 minutes), so you can add it to your taste.

Alley tours are held twice every Saturday (10:00, 14:00). For groups of 15 or more, you can freely explore the course at any time if you make a reservation in advance. Alley tour application is Jung-gu Office of Daegu Metropolitan City ( http://gu.jung.daegu.kr/new/culture/pages/main/ ). Telephone inquiries are available from the Daegu Metropolitan City Culture and Tourism Division (053-661-2194).

Bangcheon Market with a fresh old look

I went around the Bangcheon market and came back to Kim Gwangseok-gil. He wants to eat a bowl of rolled noodles and sits in front of the mural, and his voice is heard in the ear.

"Another day away
Like the smoke
In my small memory
What are you living in?

More and more away
I thought you were a youth
In my empty heart
I can't find anything anymore "

3000 won special red bean shaved ice
※ On March 8, 2018, the heavy snowfall of the Bangcheon market failed to support the weight of the snow and collapsed due to heavy snowfall in Daegu.
Currently, the site has been arranged, and there is no difficulty in passing or using shops.
We are working on it as soon as possible, but the site may be cluttered, so please refer to it before visiting.
For more information about Kim Gwangseok-gil and Bangcheon Market, you can use the tourist information center.
(Kim Gwangseokgil-Bangcheon Market: Kimgwangseokgil Tourist Information Center 053-661-3328)
Travel information

1.Nearby Restaurants

Guk-gil Gukbap: Gukbap / Jung-gu Gukchaebo-ro / 053-253-7623
Bungle Bungle Braised Ribs: Spicy Spicy Ribs / Dongdeok-ro 36-gil, Jung-gu / 053-424-6881
Grilled Makchang, Arizona: Grilled Makchang / Yonghak-ro 25-gil, Suseong-gu / 053-782-9323
Jingolmok Restaurant: Yukgaejang / Jung-gu Jingolmok-gil / 053-253-3757

2.Accommodation

Hotel Inter-Burgo: Manchon 1-dong, Suseong-gu / 053-602-7114
Grand Hotel: Beomeo 1-dong, Suseong-gu / 053-742-0001
Eldis Regent Hotel: Dongsan-dong, Jung-gu / 053-253-7711
Alto Motel: Hyomok 1-dong, Dong-gu / 053-958-4111
Yellow Motel: Samdeok 2-ga, Jung-gu / 053-428-0052

※ The above information was updated in September 2015, and may be changed later, so please check before you travel.

item.title: There is a sea in Daegu! Alive Aquarium Daegu - Dong-gu, Daegu, South Korea
item.description:
Alive Aquarium Daegu's main tank

There is a sea in Daegu! Alive Aquarium Daegu

Dong-gu, Daegu, South Korea

A hot place like an oasis has appeared in Daegu surrounded by mountains such as Palgongsan and Bisleul Mountain. The main character is 'Alive Aquarium Daegu', which was ambitiously presented at Shinsegae Department Store Daegu. It's a sea in the inland city. Alive Aquarium Daegu, as its name suggests, contains lifelike sea life every tank. Visitors are immersed in the mysterious sights of the ocean.
Underwater trip from the top of the department store
Alive Aquarium Daegu (hereafter Alive Aquarium) can be found on the 9th floor, the top floor of Shinsegae Department Store Daegu Main Building. It is an aquarium set in the highest position in Korea. The sea creatures on display are about 200 species, including manatees, California sea lions and zebra sharks. Viewing routes consisted of a one-way that allows you to look around all the exhibition spaces from the entrance to the exit in one direction. It is about 800m long and takes about 95 minutes.
Fantastic view of the jellyfish aquarium
The first thing you'll encounter past the entrance to the Alive Aquarium is the jellyfish aquarium, which embellishes the interior with a fluorescent sky. The moment you see it, it is a sight that makes you resilient. As the jellyfish floats across the cylindrical aquarium, spreading its caps, a small full moon, like its name (full moon jellyfish), floats. Elegant movements that cannot be imitated by any living creature add to the ever-changing lighting, giving you a slightly dreamy atmosphere. The jellyfish aquarium is mirrored on four sides, creating a magnificent view.
Jellyfish wide open
When you leave the jellyfish aquarium, three long rectangular tanks occupy space. The garden is a scary garden where the tail is buried in the sand, the Bangga Cardinal with its cute looks and slender fins, the unicorn with its horns on its head, and the parakeet that resembles a parrot's beak. Can be.
Sea ecosystems in long tanks
Garden-il attracts the attention of visitors because of its rather silly appearance. The elongated body that oozes out over the sand is like a blade of grass swaying in the wind.
Garden work with a tail buried in the sand and swimming Bengalika Cardinal
Cafés and kids zones greet visitors as they pass by the fish tank and photo tank where you can take commemorative photos. Kids Zone has a touch pool where children can touch eel and octopus, and a facility where children can play with various toys. There is a sketch aquarium on one wall. After coloring the paper on which the sea creatures are drawn, scan the finished picture on the device and the animal appears on the screen to swim. While energetic kids are engrossed in playing, adults can enjoy a bit of tea at a cafe.
Kids Zone for Children
There is also a small zoo inside the Alive Aquarium. You'll find a cute hare, land turtle Sulgata, a crazy meerkat and a raccoon that rides through trees. Rabbits and turtles can be touched directly by the zookeeper. Children squirm behind the rabbits, imitating rabbits, and stroking their mothers and zookeepers and petting them.
Children petting a rabbit
The Seaso Manatee is the mascot of the Alive Aquarium. I am proud of a cute appearance not to match the size and get a lot of popularity. There are only a thousand rare species left in the world, so it is worth noting.
Manatee Enjoying Swimming <Photo courtesy of Alive Aquarium>
The Manatee Aquarium reproduces the depth of Manatee's main habitat, a lagoon (a shallow lake separated from the sea by sedimentary obstacles such as sand). Manatee eats 20 kg of vegetables per day, including bok choy, cabbage, cabbage, and jerk. It's interesting to see how people use their hands to eat vegetables as if they were people. Excessive amounts of waste are excreted frequently, which feed on omnivorous fish in the same aquarium.
State of Manatee Aquarium
If you keep moving along the viewing route, you will have a spacious space. You can meet the treehouse where you can feed animals such as parrots and interact with them. The screen also allows you to observe the features of parrots and otters in detail.
Mother with Child Looking at California Sea Lion
After watching the magic show and walking, the 360-degree sardine aquarium on the ceiling reveals itself. You can enjoy the lively group of sardines. The ecstasy of the sardines' movement in groups. A little exaggeration is the feeling of seeing the Milky Way swirling in the night sky. The dark interior, herds of sardines revealing a silver belly, and the aquarium design reminiscent of human eyes create an artistic harmony. Seats are reserved for convenience.
Herd of Sardine Swarm
From the sardine aquarium, you can meet the clownfish, famous for Nemo, while passing through a tunnel reminiscent of a tunnel. Then, after leaving the corner, the main tank, the sea of Daegu, will appear. It has a small sea with zebra sharks, large stingrays and sea turtles.
An aquarium was placed in the passage reminiscent of the tunnel.
It's amazing and fun just to look at it, but the specialty of the main tank is complete with a variety of programs. The Blue Mermaid is a beautiful feast of three mermaids among sea creatures. Every time the mermaid waved and smiles at the younger crowd, cheers burst out. 'Alive Girls' is a delightful underwater ballet performance, and 'Igley and Friends' is a program where the aquaticist closes the sea creatures with a camera in the tank.
A Blue Mermaid performance <Photo courtesy of Alive Aquarium>
The Shark Bridge is installed near the main tank. Literally, it's a bridge where you can walk on sharks. After the Shark Bridge experience, the tour ends with a giant grouper called `` Siktam Hemp King ''. The Giant Grouper was originally from the main tank and was thrown out of his current tank because he was eating a shark.
Visitors walking the Shark Bridge
Move space from the sea to the jungle, 'Juraji', a rooftop theme park
After watching the Alive Aquarium, go out through the aisle and you will see the rooftop theme park 'Juraji' with the concept of a jungle. The underwater journey ends and the jungle exploration begins. You are moving from space to a completely different environment.
Panoramic view of the rooftop theme park `` Juraji ''
In the Juraji, various sculptures that fit the concept were placed. The elephant 'Choji' lies down in front of the fountain, and the three ladybug trains carry the children and run between the legs of the giant spider 'Buibui'. The wood crocodile Gumu is willing to slide his head out for the kids. On one side, bamboo baobabs stand majestic. In the meantime, various wild animals such as giraffe and rhinoceros hang out. Visitors can walk through a wooden deck that extends into the air, overlooking an African-like landscape.
There is a wooden deck among the baobabs.
At the end of the roof, you can step on a fluffy mound and have a view of downtown Daegu and Palgong Mountain. It is popular as a date place for lovers to see the night view at night. Dongdaegu Station, shown to the right, is the main stage of the movie <To Busan>. It is a scene where a train running toward Busan stops in the ruins of Dongdaegu, and people who are not infected with zombies, such as sharing, struggle with zombies that have increased exponentially.
Giraffe Sculpture
Concentric Filled Aquarium, Alive Aquarium
Throughout the Alive Aquarium, the children's laughter and groaning continued. Responding violently to every mysterious gesture of the sea creatures, he revealed the pleasures of raw foods. The feelings of the child were conveyed to the adults, and the adults looked into the aquarium with pure eyes as if returning to their childhood for a while. The aquarium of Alive Aquarium was filled with generational concentricity.
Travel info

Alive Aquarium Daegu
-Address: 9th floor, Shinsegae Department Store Daegu, 149 Dongbu-ro, Dong-gu, Daegu Metropolitan City
Contact: 053-247-8899

http://www.aliveaqua.com/


Restaurants near
P.F Chang's: Mongolian Beef / Shinsegae Department Store Daegu 8F, Luang Street / 053-661-6873

http://www.pfchangs.co.kr/

-Gangsan Myeonok: Pyeongyang Naengmyeon / Shinsegae Department Store Daegu Branch 8F, Luang Street / 053-661-6862
-Tong House Night: Tempura Tung House / 12, Ayang-ro 7-gil, Dong-gu, Daegu, Korea


Rooms
Daegu Grand Hotel: 305, Dongdaegu-ro, Suseong-gu / 053-742-0001

http://www.daegugrand.co.kr/grand/main/index.php

-Benikea Hotel Suseong: 106-7, Yonghak-ro, Suseong-gu / 1899-1001
http://www.hotelsusung.co.kr
-Aega: 46-6, Seoseong-ro 16-gil, Jung-gu / 053-781-5215

http://aegahanok.modoo.at/



※ The above information was updated in January 2019 and may change afterwards. Please check before traveling.

item.title: Is it a museum or a cafe? Daegu Coffee Famous Raffinka - Suseong-gu, Daegu, South Korea
item.description:
Suspicious Coffee Country “Coffee Famous Lafinka”

Is it a museum or a cafe? Daegu Coffee Famous Raffinka

Suseong-gu, Daegu, South Korea

Red small door in a white building. It resembles the door to Alice's Wonderland. Imagine the scenery inside the door for a moment in front of the handles where coffee beans are scattered. What are you waiting for in the afternoon of a drowsy city? I may meet myself as pure as naive and fearless Alice. He enters the door without hesitation.
Mysterious space where coffee cherries first welcome
Happy Coffee Farm
Daegu is at the center of the coffee shop nationwide. It is no exaggeration to say that the coffee loves of Daegu citizens began with “coffee masters”. The coffee shop opened in 1990, nine years ahead of the first Ewha Womans Starbucks store. The first shop, which opened at the north gate of Kyungpook National University, began roasting when it wasn't even enough to roast coffee itself. Those who spent their school days drinking Americano became high quality coffee lovers and made Daegu a city of coffee.
Daegu became a paradise for local coffee brands, with Da Vinci, Slipless in Seattle (SIS), hands coffee and Espresso. In the meantime, the number of coffee shops has grown to thirty-four places nationwide, and in December last year, the coffee shop Lapinka was opened in Manchon-dong, Suseong-gu.
Lapinca, which means farm in Spanish
La Finca means "farm" in Spanish. In recent years Daegwanryeong has a coffee plantation, but the coffee we drink is almost dependent on income. Nevertheless, he named the farm and dreams of a farm. It is intended to convey the calmness of the farm, the impression of the mountains, and the true nature of coffee. From the name you can feel the truth of coffee.
Beans from coffee farms around the world
Ahn Myung-kyu, founder of the coffee master, calls himself a “coffee hunter”. Delicious coffee comes from fresh, good beans. Where there are good green beans, go to any rough road. They visit the farms of coffee-producing countries such as Guatemala, El Salvador, Kenya, Brazil, Colombia, and Ethiopia. In particular, it signed an exclusive contract with El Inherto Farm, which won the Guatemala Cup of Excellence for six consecutive years.
24 years since roasting beans and extracting them carefully
Coffee shop Rafinka costs just 1,000 won for espresso and Americano every morning from 8 am to 30 minutes! This coffee is called 'happy coffee'. Happy coffee sales are all used as happy funds. The happy fund becomes a playground for coffee farmers who sell directly with coffee masters, a book, and even a teacher's salary. I want to keep the children there to keep good green beans. Perhaps the taste of coffee begins with the very heart.
24 years since roasting beans and extracting them carefully
Dreaming Coffee Museum
When you step inside a large building with coffee berries, you will be greeted by coffee cherries and green beans. Entering the cafe with the hospitality of exotic coffee cherries and handsome coffee beans, young coffee trees grow dazzling in front of the cool window.
Door decorated with coffee mug and beans
Inside the cafe there is a showcase displaying beans and coffee extraction tools. This showcase is painted in coffee and has a pretty coffee color. The coffee color is as comfortable as the hanok floor.
Feel the fun of shoveling green beans.
In the small space next to the stairs to the second floor, there are old coffee roasting tools and exotic items. I feel as though I'm at a coffee farm across the Pacific Ocean.
Old roasting tools
You can also enjoy the fun of sesame seeding while visiting green coffee mills. Then the table catches my eye. A common landscape with four chairs on a table is long and a long wooden table is rough. But it is too early to sit down.
The walls painted with coffee resemble Hanok floor.
On the wall of the stairs that goes up to the second floor, works made of coffee powder are hung. The second floor is lined with glass boxes like a museum exhibition room. In the box, specialty coffees from Yemen, Jamaica, Colombia and Kenya were displayed. Instructions and pictures of farms will help you understand the characteristics of each country's coffee.
Lovers going upstairs
You can also touch the green beans displayed by hand like jewelry under the lights. The five flavors of coffee, such as acidity, sweetness, and bitterness, are marked like car dashboards, so it's fun to pick a coffee that suits your taste without having to drink it.
The second floor where the world's specialty coffee is displayed
After leaving the main building and passing the garden, the roasting machine, which is the second largest in our country, is constantly roasting and cooling coffee. Freshly roasted coffee fragrance is not envious of honeymoon sesame salt.
Green beans and signs displayed like jewelry
Next to the roasting machine is a storehouse for green beans. In the warehouse, a huge amount of green beans imported from each country are piled in a bag. But unusually, LP plates are displayed among the green beans, and large speakers occupy one place.
The taste and quality of coffee displayed like a car dashboard
There are concerts and film festivals held every two months. It is a unique space that transforms from a warehouse into a small theater. Sitting on a coffee bag and listening to music must be a special experience. In the greenhouse in front of the warehouse, coffee trees sprouted from coffee beans are growing like a dream.
Coffee Sack Stacks
After a coffee trip, she finally settles down at a long table. If you put a piece of cake that goes well with steamed coffee in the specialty exhibition room on the 2nd floor, you will feel like you are in a strange space, not a museum or a cafe. The deep and rich coffee and a pleasant meeting of the museum are fun.
Greenhouse where coffee trees grow like a dream
And a cup of communication with me
I asked Ahn Myung-kyu what is coffee in one word? “Coffee is communication.” In high school, when I went to the library as my home, he fell in love with coffee, saying that the conversation he had while drinking a cup of coffee offered by a teacher was warm and fragrant. In order to create a space to communicate with coffee, he opened a coffee house. The coffee master does not mean 'named house'. It uses the word ‘명 (明)’ to express the desire to create a bright space, that is, a space for communication. I just didn't want a coffee shop. I wanted to know the beginning of coffee, taste the coffee culture, and communicate through coffee.
Communication space
Coffee is hard to explain simply by saying 'delicious'. A myriad of diverse flavors such as sour, sweet, fruity, earthy are in harmony. The process of harvesting, roasting, and extracting everything from the natural environment of the mountain determines the taste of the coffee. But above all, it is no exaggeration to say that with whom to drink coffee to complete the taste of coffee.
Lapinca from the Garden
Wouldn't the greatest joy of drinking coffee be in conversation with coffee rather than the aroma and flavor of coffee? Most important of all is a cup of coffee to share with myself. Billy Joel said, "There is comfort in my coffee cup." What's in your cup of coffee today?
A cup of communication with myself
Travel info

Coffee Famous Raffinka

Address: 953-1, Gukchaebosang-ro, Suseong-gu, Daegu
Contact: 053-743-0892

http://www.misungbok.co.kr

item.title: Daegu Metro Line 3, Sky Train Running Through the City - Jung-gu, Daegu, South Korea
item.description:
Daegu sky train running into the sunset

Daegu Metro Line 3, Sky Train Running Through the City

Jung-gu, Daegu, South Korea

Daegu Ground Railroad, which opened in April, is called a running observatory. A 10-metre high sky train runs over downtown Daegu and presents dynamic scenery. Passing between tall buildings, running across a wide river, flying over rooftops, you encounter Daegu with a different face. Sunsets and sunrises between buildings are also special. When you get off the sky train, you will see Daegu's attractions and food. Line 3 is the new starting point for the exciting Daegu trip.
Daegu's attraction in the sky
"Aze ~ This station is a achievement park." “Yeah, this station is Aigar Park Station where Saturn is located. If you are going to Dalseong Park or Daegu Native History Museum, you can get off at the right door. ”The Daegu Urban Railway Line 3, where the dialect announcement is heard, is catching the air. The first urban railway was opened in Daegu in 1997. Line 2 was completed in 2005, and line 3 began service on April 23, 10 years later. By May 31, there are 3 million visitors. An average of 76,500 people a day ride the train, which makes it more popular.
Run cool on the city without blockage
Daegu Metro Line 3 is a ground train called the Sky Rail, not a subway that runs through the basement. The sky train, with an average height of 11m, offers a panoramic view of the city.
Line 3 leaving Dalachi Park Station
When you cross the 200m wide Kumho River, you will feel like you are flying above the river. In Nam-gu, the mountains in front of the dense dwelling roofs face each other, and the Suseong Pond appears to the right as the Suseong Pond Station approaches. Behind the scenes, the sun breaks along the white waves and the train slides through the buildings. It is unexplored in Daegu.
Shincheon scenery from across Daebong Bridge
The view of Daegu through Line 3 after dark is also new. One or two lights are lit in each building, and the clothes are changed with colorful neon signs. Car lights passing under the trains flow like rivers, and the buildings standing on both sides along the Beomcheon stream catch the eye. It's also special to see the sun shining and reddening the building forest on the train.
The sunset seen from the train is more special
The sky train that runs from Daegu to north and south passes through 30 stations, ranging from Dongho-dong Chilgok Gyeongdae Hospital Station in Buk-gu to Beommul-dong Site in Suseong-gu. It takes 48 minutes to pass through the entire 24km section. It runs cool without waiting for a signal or being stuffy. It took 20 minutes or more to take more than 70 minutes when using a car. It runs from 5:30 am to 12:00 pm, every five minutes during morning and evening rush hours, and every other seven minutes. The rubber wheel of the vehicle is wrapped around the track beam to drive, so there is little noise and vibration, and the ride is comfortable, so you can feel comfortable in the scenery.
Passengers with a comfortable view of the city
Daegu Sky Train is Korea's first public transport monorail. In the world, there are not many examples of monorail in public transportation. It operates in 14 countries around the world, including Tokyo, Japan, Osaka, Chongqing, China and Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Among them, the Daegu sky train is the longest. We are proud of the best in technical part. As you pass through apartments and dense residential areas, a window-blocking device will protect your privacy. In the event of an emergency, Spiral Chute and a water spray-type automatic fire extinguishing system were installed to escape safely to the ground. It's an unattended operation, but worry can be put aside. One safety officer rides on each vehicle and monitors Chilgok vehicle base control system in real time through CCTV.
Korea's first public transport monorail
To transfer to another line, you can transfer to Line 1 at Myeongdeok Station and Line 2 at Sinnam Station.
Moving Observation Deck in Daegu City
Attractions in Daegu on Line 3
The station that people ride most is Seomun Market Station. The opening of Line 3 increased the number of visitors to the market by 40% on weekends. Exit the escalator at Exit 3 and you're at the market entrance. Previously, you had to walk 10 minutes from Sinnam Station on Line 2. Seomun Market, which was selected as the three largest market place in the Joseon Dynasty with Pyongyang and Ganggyeongjang, is the largest traditional market in Daegu. There are 4,700 stores in eight districts, including Dongsan Shopping Mall, except street vendors. There are so many things to see and do that you can't go around with half a day.
Attractions in Daegu on Line 3
In Seomun Market, you can't miss the food. In the Kalguksu Alley, where more than 50 noodle crises are gathered, people looking for hot kalguksu are hot even in hot weather.
Seomun Market Kalguksu Alley
Don't miss the barley rice. If you rub a lot of herbs in gochujang, you can literally taste honey. In addition, to eat flat dumplings, hotteok, tteokbokki, Sundae, etc., it takes several days to starve. The good news is that the night market will open in August. The night scenery of Seomun Market is already awaited.
Kalguksu and Barley Rice
After exploring the five senses at the Seomun Market, head toward the modern alley. Crossing Dalseong-ro from the market and walk about 400m to the side of Dongsan Hospital, Cheongna Hill is where the modern alley begins.
Flat dumplings belonging to 10 Daegu
If people are crowded at Seomun Market Station during the day, it is Suseongmot Station at night. Beomeocheon, which stretches straight up and down the Suseongmot Station, is a newly emerging photo zone. The dimly lit buildings and colorful buildings blend together to create a new look of Daegu night view. After watching the night view of Beomeocheon, you can walk about 5 minutes to Suseong Pond. Unlike the daytime scenery where you can enjoy the cool breeze of the lake and take a duck boat, the night view of Suseong Pond is gorgeous. A cool fountain show takes place to match the lighting and music. A variety of street performances take you around the promenade around the lake.
Night view of Suseong Pond with a music fountain show
When you get off at Dalseong Park Station, Dalseong Park is a place where you can meet old Saturn and mysterious animals, and you can walk to the Daegu Art Power Plant for free.
Dalung Park Gwanpungru
Get off at Daebong Station and walk for 10 minutes along Sincheon. In the alley full of murals reminiscent of singer Kim Gwang-seok, Kim Gwang-seok's song flows. The children's hall has the largest number of children. The lawn is a shelter for families, and an exhibition hall for various scientific experiences is a children's playground.
Citizens enjoying green walks along Saturn Park
Among the trains, the train with the theme of “Robocar Poly” is popular among children. Suseongmot Station, Dalseong Park Station, and Seomun Market Station give another fun to the broadcast by the friendly dialect.
Children cheering as Robocar Poli train comes in
Travel info

Daegu Metropolitan Rapid Transit Corporation / 250, Wolbae-ro, Dalseo-gu, Daegu, Korea / 053-643-2114
-Seomun Market / 45, Daejang-ro 26-gil, Jung-gu, Daegu / 053-256-6341
-Suseong Pond / 35-5, Yonghak-ro, Suseong-gu, Daegu / Suseong-gu Office 053-666-2863

Restaurants near

-Most-Fugu Blowfish: Pufferfish Cuisine / 87, Dean-ro, Suseong-gu / 053-767-8877
-Jingol Alley Restaurant: Yukgaejang / 9-1 Jingolmok-gil, Jung-gu / 053-253-3757


Rooms

-Suseong Hotel: 106-7, Yonghak-ro, Suseong-gu / 1899-1001
Daegu Grand Hotel: 305, Dongdaegu-ro, Suseong-gu / 053-742-0001

http://www.daegugrand.co.kr/

-Sympathy Guest House: 32, Jungang-daero 79-gil, Jung-gu / 070-8915-8991

http://blog.naver.com/empathy215
